Event.name: Arrest
Event.definition: <def-root><fen>Authorities</fen> charge a <fen>Suspect</fen>, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the <fen>Charges</fen>), and take him/her into custody.<ex><fex name="Authorities">The police</fex> <t>arrested</t> <fex name="Suspect">Harry</fex> <fex name="Chrg">on charges of manslaughter</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Charges
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Charges</fen> identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is charged.<ex>The police <t>arrested</t> Harry <fex name="Chrg">on charges of manslaughter</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arrest occurs.<ex>The police <t>arrested</t> Harry <fex name="Place">in front of his house</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arrest occurs. <ex>The police <t>arrested</t> Harry <fex name="Time">on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Authorities
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.<ex><fex name="Authorities">The police</fex> <t>arrested</t> Harry on charges of manslaughter.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Suspect
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.<ex>The police <t>arrested</t> <fex name="Suspect">Harry</fex> on charges of manslaughter.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Type
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the subtype of arrest under which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is placed. <ex>The police placed Harry under <fex name="Type">house</fex> <t>arrest</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Offense
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Offense</fen> identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested. <ex>They arrested Harry <fex name="Offense">for shoplifting</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the arresting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Authorities</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which <fen>Authorities</fen> arrest a <fen>Suspect</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which <fen>Authorities</fen> arrest a <fen>Suspect</fen>. <ex>The police <t>arrested</t> Harry <fex name="Purpose">to get him off the street</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source_of_legal_authority
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source_of_legal_authority</fen> describe the law which grants the power of arrest to the <fen>Authorities</fen>. <ex><fex name="Authorities">The policeman</fex> <t>arrested</t> <fex name="Suspect">him</fex> <fex name="Source_of_legal_authority">under the "suspected loitering with intent" power</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A person that participates in the event along with the <fen>Authorities</fen> or the <fen>Suspect</fen>.
<ex>She was <t>arrested</t> <fex name="Co-participant">with the Minister of Finance, Javier Soledad</fex> .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: arrest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: seize (someone) by legal authority and take them into custody.

lexUnit.name: apprehend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: intercept (someone) in the course of harmful or illicit action, seize or arrest (someone).

lexUnit.name: apprehension.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of arresting someone.

lexUnit.name: book.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make an official note of the details of (someone who has broken a law or rule).

lexUnit.name: summons.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: serve an order to appear in court
